page.title: 15Musically Speaking....
page.content: Crosskeys College Choral Society, formed 1981, comprises students, staff and members of the community. Risca Male Voice Choir (Male Choir of the Year 1982), founded 1969, gives up to 24 concerts each year. Its repertoire ranges from C17 church music to "pop". The conductor and accompanist were born in, and still live in, Risca. Risca also has a ladies' choir and a "concert party", the Phoenix Singers. Performances, mostly local, are for Senior Citizens and Church groups. Crosskeys Silver Band is a top class (Section A) band. It performs locally, throughout the country and on radio and T.V. The Junior Band are also champions. Crosskeys College Brass Consort was formed in January 1985. The College has the only concert hall in the area. Seating over 400, it is used by amateurs and professionals.
